attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Landscape Architecture
397A
UMass Amherst
Residential garden -- introduction to translating client needs into a program of activities. Recreation and open space -- a systematic view of open space networks. Concepts of public, semi-public, and private spaces. Methods of site analysis and programming activities emphasized.
This course is open to LANDARCH and ENVIRDES majors only.   Students should enroll in both LANDARCH 397A and LANDARCH 397B.
Students who do not meet the eligibility requirements may seek permission of the instructor to enroll.

attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Landscape Architecture
614
UMass Amherst
Design of site structures and required details focusing on stability, durability, and environmental compatibility. Emphasis on statics and strength of materials of site structures. Includes sizing of water retention and detention structures.
Open to Graduate students only.
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

attributes.Title: ST-Site Engineering Constructn
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Landscape Architecture
397E
UMass Amherst
Site engineering problems related to general design including: construction processes, road alignment geometry, grading, drainage systems, earthwork, and detailing. Emphasis on construction document preparation.
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

attributes.Title: Ideas That Change the World
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Honors College
201
UMass Amherst
In this seminar, students will examine texts and works of art that have profoundly shaped the world we live in. The course is divided into four units: Models of Inquiry; the Impact of Science and Technology; Social Philosophy and Civic Engagement; and Art in the World. The course is supplemented with several plenary lectures by distinguished honors faculty speakers.
This course is open to Commonwealth Honors College students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
16389

attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Regional Planning
635
UMass Amherst

attributes.Title: ST-Studio IV
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Landscape Architecture
397D
UMass Amherst
Institutional and commercial scale -- issues of design for commercial and industrial uses. May cover the spectrum from a site plan for an office complex to a marina. Issues of cost, client needs, program, and politics. Site planning -- introduction to concepts of site planning for housing developments. Students perform a detailed site assessment using methods learned in natural factors and previous studio on a 100-acre (+/-) site and apply them to development of a master plan.
LANDARCH mjrs only   Students who do not meet the pre-requisites, may seek permission of the instructor to enroll.     This is the second section of studio.   Students should also be enrolled in LANDARCH 397C.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
62920
Requisite: LANDARCH mjrs only   Students who do not meet the pre-requisites, may seek permission of the instructor to enroll.     This is the second section of studio.   Students should also be enrolled in LANDARCH 397C.

attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Landscape Architecture
297A
UMass Amherst
Introduction to Design -- basic introduction to two-dimensional concepts of design. Line, form, contrast, repetition, symmetry, texture, scale, and other design techniques.  Models -- introduction to three-dimensional design thinking by creating spaces through land form, vegetation, and structure.
Envirdes,Landarch&LandCon(stk)   Students should enroll in both LANDARCH 297A and LANDARCH 297B.
Students who do not meet the eligibility requirements may seek permission of the instructor to enroll.

attributes.Title: Studio VI
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Landscape Architecture
603
UMass Amherst
The garden as the most personal, direct, and intimate expression of landscape architecture, as a contemporary art primarily through discussions of important works and design theory in the genre. Emphasis on developing an informed and creative personal approach which inspires while solving practical problems on real sites.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
32968

attributes.Title: S-Restoring Community
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Landscape Architecture
593E
UMass Amherst
This design studio engages the topic of food security: at both the global and local level, through both theory and design, and from the perspective of the individual and the collective. Students will interrogate their local foodshed and develop new strategies for productive landscapes, and in the process, cultivate their own ethic/practice/values. In developing a kitchen garden for the UMass campus, students will link theory and design to address the environmental, social, economic and aesthetic needs of their client and program. Initially, students will work individually to develop small-scale prototypes for food production. As the semester continues, students will work in teams to develop a comprehensive design for a kitchen garden, which will be built.
Join UMass Amherst landscape architecture students for a housing design studio in the spring. The four credit
class will address the importance of landscape design in building a sense of community in
neighborhoods and towns. Students will work individually and in groups on a host of design exercises,
leading up to the development of a final project for multifamily housing landscapes. In connecting critical
theory to the best practices in landscape architecture, students will develop original design solutions for
resilient future neighborhoods.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
12736

attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Landscape Architecture
503

attributes.Title: Landscape Pattern & Process
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Landscape Architecture
547
UMass Amherst
Landscape patterns resulting from interactions of biotic, abiotic, and cultural resources and processes over time. Understanding these dynamics as a prerequisite to appropriate planning and design interventions.
Students taking this to fulfill departmental requirements in Landscape Architecture, Environmental Design, or Regional Planning will also need to take a one-credit lab.
Students must be concurrently enrolled in the lecture section of LANDARCH 547 and one of the LANDARCH 547L sections.
Lab sections will meet at Hills, then travel to various locations.   Contact the instructor and/or refer to the syllabus for additional details.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
33023
Requisite: Landscape patterns resulting from interactions of biotic, abiotic, and cultural resources and processes over time. Understanding these dynamics as a prerequisite to appropriate planning and design interventions.

2016
Landscape Architecture

Issues of cost, client needs, program, and politics. Site planning -- introduction to concepts of site planning for housing developments. Students perform a detailed site assessment using methods learned in natural factors and previous studio on a 100-acre (+/-) site and apply them to development of a master plan.
LANDARCH mjrs only   Students who do not meet the pre-requisites, may seek permission of the instructor to enroll.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
